alert.note: Alert for Garland; Hot Spring; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 24 at 2:38PM CST until February 24 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Garland County in central Arkansas... West Central Lonoke County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Pulaski County in central Arkansas... Southeastern Saline County in central Arkansas... Northern Hot Spring County in southwestern Arkansas... * Until 500 PM CST. * At 238 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen so far today. Additional showers and thunderstorms are moving back over this same area again...with additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches possible. As a result...flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Hot Springs, Benton, Bryant, Malvern, Downtown Little Rock, Southwest Little Rock, Haskell, Shannon Hills, Wrightsville, Argenta, Rockport, Traskwood, Tull, Lonsdale, Salem in Saline County, Otter Creek, Mabelvale and Hot Springs National Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Garland; Hot Spring; Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline
